what: 1.1 This package can be used to address following issues:
title: Local Indicator of Stratified Power
text: Identify local power individual determinants. Explore spatial stratified association changes spatially local regions.

title: Local Indicator of Stratified Power
text: Install stable version, please use: Install development version, please use: 1.3 General calculation process LISP model: Figure 1 shows process LISP, comprising three sequential steps. First, optimal extent local identified using spatial variogram satisfy criterion sufficiently small range ensure data within extent exhibit adequate heterogeneity association. second step analyze PD individual variables response variable GD modeling optimal spatial discretization algorithms parameters local scale. final step quantify local PD interaction variables, including interaction pair spatial variables interaction multiple variables, using tree-based spatial discretization approach stratified heterogeneity approaches.
code: install.packages("localsp", dep = TRUE) install.packages("localsp",                  repos = c("https://ausgis.r-universe.dev",                            "https://cloud.r-project.org"),                  dep = TRUE)

title: Local Indicator of Stratified Power
text: gtc.csv dataset documents glacier thickness changes (GTC) 2000 2020, along potential influencing factors Greater Himalayas, encompassing Hengduan Mountains, Himalayas, Nyainqentanglha Mountains, Karakoram, Hindu Kush (see Figure2). Variables WinTem, SumTem, Pre represent linear trends winter temperature, summer temperature, precipitation 2000–2020 period. Elev, Aspect, Slope derived NASADEM data correspond elevation, aspect, slope, respectively. LakeArea indicates area glacial lakes, SurAlbedo, calculated MODIS products, represents surface albedo glaciers.

previous_headings: Case study: identifying local stratified determinants of Mountain glacier thickness
title: Local Indicator of Stratified Power
code: v = gstat::variogram(GTC ~ 1, data = gtc, cloud = F) v ##       np       dist     gamma dir.hor dir.ver   id ## 1  14931   39.33453 0.4743007       0       0 var1 ## 2  15815  109.54341 0.6589910       0       0 var1 ## 3  16588  185.03042 0.5761573       0       0 var1 ## 4  19754  256.38421 0.5980874       0       0 var1 ## 5  20459  329.91127 0.5577942       0       0 var1 ## 6  18543  401.88149 0.6276614       0       0 var1 ## 7  16864  474.87660 0.6135782       0       0 var1 ## 8  15980  549.52079 0.5865082       0       0 var1 ## 9  17769  623.60036 0.5960570       0       0 var1 ## 10 17245  693.03051 0.5546563       0       0 var1 ## 11 13694  768.17532 0.6192201       0       0 var1 ## 12 14019  841.81593 0.5845925       0       0 var1 ## 13 13084  914.49653 0.6409234       0       0 var1 ## 14 11224  988.46713 0.6174315       0       0 var1 ## 15 12948 1060.66167 0.6082240       0       0 var1 plot(v,main = "Variogram - default", xlab = "Separation distance (km)") # Intial parameter set by eye esitmation expm = gstat::vgm(0.3,"Exp",range = 400,0.3) # least square fit expmf = gstat::fit.variogram(v, expm) ## Warning in gstat::fit.variogram(v, expm): No convergence after 200 iterations: ## try different initial values? expmf ##   model     psill   range ## 1   Nug 0.0000000  0.0000 ## 2   Exp 0.6241965 27.4061 plot(v, pl=F, model=expmf,col="black", cex=1, lwd=0.5,lty=1,pch=20,      main="Variogram models - Exponential",xlab="Distance (km)",ylab="Semivariance")

what: local indicator of stratified power — lisp
title: local indicator of stratified power — lisp
local indicator of stratified power — lisp
code: lisp(   formula,   data,   bandwidth,   discvar = NULL,   discnum = 3:8,   discmethod = c("sd", "equal", "geometric", "quantile", "natural"),   cores = 1,   ... )

title: local indicator of stratified power — lisp
text: formula formula. data sf object observation data. bandwidth bandwidth employed select "local" data. discvar Name continuous variable columns need discretized. Noted formula discvar, data must columns. default, independent variables used discvar. discnum (optional) vector number classes discretization. Default 3:8. discmethod (optional) vector methods discretization, default using c("sd","equal","geometric","quantile","natural") invoking sdsfun. cores (optional) Positive integer (default 1). cores greater 1, use multi-core parallel computing. ... (optional) arguments passed gdverse::gd_opttunidisc(). useful parameter seed, used set random number seed.
